text:
Lafayette Ave. (foreground, not seen), south side, between Metcalf and Fteley Aves., showing farm land on the former estate of E. H. Ludlow (Bromley map of 1913). The low brick homes in the background face on Rosedale Ave.

July 30, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Lafayette Ave. (foreground, not seen), adjoining the N.E. corner of Metcalf Ave., showing a farm house occupying that site on the former estate of E. H. Ludlow (Bromley map of 1913).

July 30, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Metcalf Ave. (foreground, not seen), west side, between Lafayette and Seward Aves. The view is in a southwesterly direction showing a cultivated field. In the background is visible the coke plant of the Consolidated Edison Company.

July 30, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
